column5: Has anyone stayed at this resort?? Am going there in early June. Any feedback would be appreciated.
The people that own it are really nice and have a great place. You might have to travel to catch fish. I would recommend fishing with one of the sons the first day to help get on the fish.
Thanks, that sounds like a good idea, since none of us have fished that chain before. There's something about Lac Seul!!!!

That chain of lakes has some large walleyes in it, last year i was on clearwater and nailed 3 10 pund walleye in one evening. You got to look around the 22-25 foot zone on some of the midlake reefs.....but be careful the reefs are very hitable...just look for the seagulls, they usually sit on top of them. Also a good chance to catch some huge muskie...saw one there one night that gave me the chills.
